description: Primes that are the sum of three consecutive primes.
comments: Or, primes in A034961 (Sums of three consecutive primes). - _Zak Seidov_, Feb 16 2011
links: Zak Seidov, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: E.g., 131 = 41 + 43 + 47.A034962(n) = p+q+r, where p = A073681(n), and p<q<r are three consecutive primes. - _Zak Seidov_, Mar 09 2009
maple: a:=proc(n) if isprime(ithprime(n)+ithprime(n+1)+ithprime(n+2))=true then ithprime(n)+ithprime(n+1)+ithprime(n+2) else fi end: seq(a(n), n=1..120); # _Emeric Deutsch_, Apr 24 2006
mathematica: a = {}; Do[k = Prime[x] + Prime[x + 1] + Prime[x + 2]; If[PrimeQ[k], AppendTo[a, k]], {x, 1, 350}]; a (* _Artur Jasinski_, Jan 27 2007 *)Select[(Plus@@@Partition[Prime[Range[200]],3,1]),PrimeQ] (* _Moshe Levin_, Feb 07 2012 *)Select[ListConvolve[{1,1,1},Prime[Range[200]]],PrimeQ] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jul 12 2013 *)
prog: (PARI) forprime(p=2,1000, p2=nextprime(p+1); p3=nextprime(p2+1); q=p+p2+p3; if(isprime(q),print1(q",")) ) \\ _Max Alekseyev_, Jan 26 2007(PARI) {p=2;q=3;for(n=1,100,r=nextprime(q+1); if(isprime(t=p+q+r),print1(t","));p=q;q=r;)} \\ _Zak Seidov_, Mar 09 2009
crossrefs: Cf. A073681 (smallest of three consecutive primes whose sum is a prime).
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Oct 15 1998
